## Introduction
The purpose of this documentation is to provide guidance on managing open source license compliance using Github. It will cover the steps involved in ensuring that your project complies with the necessary open source licenses, as well as best practices and recommendations for maintaining compliance.

## Objective and Scope
The objective of this documentation is to help developers and project managers understand the importance of open source license compliance and provide them with the necessary tools and knowledge to manage compliance effectively. The scope of this documentation covers the use of Github as a platform for managing open source license compliance.

## Requirements and Pre-requisites
Before proceeding with managing open source license compliance on Github, ensure that you have the following requirements and pre-requisites in place:

- A Github account
- Knowledge of open source licenses and their requirements
- Familiarity with Git and Github workflows

## Step-by-Step Instructions
1. Identify the open source licenses used in your project. Make a list of all the licenses and their corresponding files.
2. Create a LICENSE file in the root directory of your project. This file should include the full text of the open source licenses used in your project.
3. Add license information to each source file. Include a license header at the top of each file, specifying the license under which it is distributed.
4. Use a tool or service to scan your project for open source licenses. There are several tools available that can automatically detect and identify open source licenses in your project's codebase.
5. Document the open source licenses used in your project. Create a file, such as LICENSES.md, that lists all the open source licenses used, along with the corresponding files and their locations.
6. Regularly review and update your license documentation. As your project evolves, it's important to keep track of any changes to the open source licenses used.
7. Make your license documentation easily accessible. Add a link to your license documentation in your project's README file or other prominent locations.

## Code Snippets and Commands
Here are some code snippets and commands that may be useful when managing open source license compliance on Github:

- To create a LICENSE file in the root directory of your project, use the following command:
  ```
  touch LICENSE
  ```

- To add a license header to a source file, include the following comment at the top of the file:
  ```
  // SPDX-License-Identifier: [license]
  ```

- To scan your project for open source licenses using a tool like FOSSA, use the following command:
  ```
  fossa scan
  ```

## Troubleshooting and Common Issues
- Issue: Missing or incomplete license information in source files.
  Solution: Review each source file and ensure that it includes the appropriate license header.

- Issue: Difficulty identifying open source licenses used in the project.
  Solution: Use a license scanning tool or service to automatically detect and identify open source licenses in your project's codebase.

## Best Practices and Recommendations
- Keep track of all the open source licenses used in your project and their corresponding files. This will help ensure that you are in compliance with all necessary licenses.

- Regularly review and update your license documentation as your project evolves. This will help you stay organized and avoid any compliance issues.

- Make your license documentation easily accessible to others. This will help potential contributors and users understand the licensing requirements of your project.

## Summary and Conclusion
Managing open source license compliance is an essential aspect of any software project. By following the steps outlined in this documentation and implementing best practices, you can ensure that your project complies with the necessary open source licenses. Remember to regularly review and update your license documentation to stay in compliance as your project evolves.
